title: Isar Aerospace sets date for first launch after receiving license
summary:
Isar Aerospace is ready to perform its first orbital launch attempt as soon as March 20 after receiving a license from Norwegian regulators.

title: Rocket Lab launches final set of Kinéis satellites
summary:
Rocket Lab has completed the deployment of a constellation of Internet-of-Things satellites for French company Kinéis with a launch March 17.

title: Pangea Aerospace Raises €23M in Series A Funding
summary:
Spanish rocket propulsion company Pangea Aerospace has raised €23 million in Series A funding, with contributions from former ArianeGroup CEO André-Hubert Roussel. Founded in 2018, Pangea Aerospace initially aimed to develop Meso, a small rocket designed to deliver 400 kilograms to low Earth orbit. The rocket was to be powered by a unique, in-house-developed methalox […]
The post Pangea Aerospace Raises €23M in Series A Funding appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Bringing the Heat: Abigail Howard Leads Thermal Systems for Artemis Rovers, Tools
summary: Depending on where you stand at the lunar South Pole, you may experience temperatures of 130°F (54°C) during sunlit periods, or as low as -334°F (-203°C) in a permanently shadowed region. title: Texas High School Aerospace Scholars: A Launchpad for Future Innovators
summary: NASA’s Office of STEM Engagement at Johnson Space Center offers Texas high school students a unique gateway to the world of space exploration through the High School Aerospace Scholars (HAS) program.
